citation.article-title: Methyloversatilis universalis gen. nov., sp. nov., a novel taxon within the Betaproteobacteria represented by three methylotrophic isolates
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Methyloversatilis universalis sp. nov.
Methyloversatilis universalis (u.ni.ver.sa′lis. L. fem. adj. universalis universal, reflecting the ubiquitous distribution of the first isolates in the environment).
Cells are 1.2±0.4×0.4±0.1 μm in size and occur singly or in pairs.
Growth occurs at pH 6–9, with optimal growth at pH 7.5–8.
Utilizes methanol, methylated amines, formaldehyde and formate, as well as a variety of multicarbon compounds.
Negative for nitrate reduction, urease activity, sugar fermentation and indole production.

Resistant to ampicillin, erythromycin, chloramphenicol, SXT, vancomycin and penicillin, but sensitive to amoxicillin, cephalothin, kanamycin, nalidixic acid, tetracycline, streptomycin, neomycin and gentamicin.
The type strain, FAM5T (=CCUG 52030T=JCM 13912T), was isolated from freshwater Lake Washington (USA).
